channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: It’s so hot in the western U.S. that some people are ‘wobbling’ and collapsing to the ground as they walk outside
item.description: About 1.2 million people were under extreme heat risk, meaning temperatures were expected to stay dangerously high with no relief overnight.

item.title: The last ‘ace’: World War II fighter pilot Donald McPherson, who shot down 5 enemy planes, dies at 103
item.description: McPherson was listed as the conflict's last living U.S. ace by both the American Fighter Aces Association and the Fagen Fighters WWII Museum.

item.title: Crews Rescue Two Women Stuck in Hot Tub at Remote Cabin
item.description: Health issues prevented the women, who were in their 80s, from climbing out, officials said. They became unresponsive after overheating and developing...

item.title: The Shawn Kemp sentence: He says his truck and cellphone were stolen and he returned fire at the thieves. Nobody was hurt but he’s under electronic home monitoring
item.description: The former NBA star looked at the ceiling and blew a huff of air when he heard his sentence, which also includes 240 hours of community service.

item.title: Why Haven’t Sanctions on Russia Stopped the War? The Money Is Still Flowing.
item.description: For decades, companies feared being on the wrong side of U.S. sanctions. That’s not always true anymore.

item.title: ‘A bit of a shock’: Even community colleges, largely nonpartisan commuter schools, are feeling the Trump education crackdown
item.description: A professor in Colorado said that at his school, you don't typically see "the kind of unrest and polarization that you see at other campuses.”

item.title: The Federal Reserve could start resembling the Supreme Court
item.description: Fed governors typically step down before their terms expire, but they may stay on until a president from their political party is in the White House.

item.title: As Other Israelis Die in War, Ultra-Orthodox Resist Call to Fight
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis, exempt for decades from military service, are now being drafted. Their rage is dividing Israel and threatening Prime Minister...

item.title: Revealing Taste
item.description: A clever leak exposed the music habits of some famous people — and two Times journalists.

item.title: Zelensky Marks Ukraine’s Independence Day With Diplomacy in Kyiv and a Plea for Peace
item.description: The Ukrainian leader held talks with Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada and was set to meet with President Trump’s envoy, Keith Kellogg, amid contin...

item.title: Peace Talks in Ukraine All Lead to the Donbas
item.description: The contested region is where Russia’s war in Ukraine began a decade ago. Scores of Ukrainian soldiers have died defending it. Would Ukraine give it u...

item.description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis, exempt for decades from military service, are now being drafted. Their rage is dividing Israel and threatening Prime Minister...

item.title: China’s Tropical Resort Island Orders Evacuations as Typhoon Kajiki Nears
item.description: Officials on Hainan Island, China’s only tropical beach destination, halted public transportation. Businesses were closed in Sanya, a popular resort c...
